ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to write well, and how to edit my work.
This course was helpful in developing my nonfiction personal narrative essay skills. I feel like my writing cohesion and engagement has vastly improved.
This course improved my writing skills, and it helped me gain a new appreciation for reading essays.

We developed our familiarity with approaches, forms, and writing processes for reading and writing personal essays. We read a lot of interesting pieces in our 5 units, and discussions in each class were a nice chance to unpack. More experience writing essays and getting feedback were great too.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This is a fantastic course. The readings are amazing, Professor Stuart was a joy to get to know, and the class size was perfect to facilitate a seminar. My favorite part of the class was the opportunities to peer-edit with my classmates, who were all such talented writers. Truly a class I won't forget.

The discussion format and blogging are very helpful in assuring that there is never a pause or dull moment in class. Also, the reading was, for the most part, a huge plus, as they were engaging and interesting. One weakness of the course is the overly harsh grading. Oftentimes, there would only be one A per paper, with most of the papers falling in between 88-93 consistently.

Strengths: The course was really engaging - we were all really close and always had nice conversations. The readings were good and Professor Stuart was really personable. 
Weaknesses: A few of the readings are on the longer side and turnover for a few of the essays is quick, but if you plan ahead a little or intentionally keep up you're fine.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The online seminar style was pretty good. Wasn't the same as a normal English classroom, but there were none of the other remote learning difficulties - the atmosphere might have been the closest thing I had this semester to a normal class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely! I think that the skills from English 120 are applicable to a lot of areas. I found that the writing skills I picked up in this course helped me in other areas as well, and it was just overall a great course to take.  I can't recommend it enough.
Yes, this course is very highly regarded for a reason. It is a great introduction to college writing and, if you take one English course at Yale, it should be this or 114.

Yes - I felt my writing skills greatly improved after taking this course. I enjoyed doing the readings and discussing them during class. Even in a virtual setting, I still got a lot out of class discussion. Prof. Stuart was very helpful both during class and in office hours. The process of turning in a first draft, peer reviewing, and revising also helped be become a better writer. If you want to put in some effort to become a better writer, take this course.
Yes!! This was a lovely, fun, interesting English course. This class was all of the discussion I hoped for in an personal essay seminar.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
